title: Two wave pulses approach and overlap

content.question: Two wave pulses approach each other, as shown in the figure above. The pulse traveling to the right is half the height and twice the width of the pulse traveling to the left. Which of the following best represents the resulting shape when the peaks of the two pulses are at the same location?

choices.label: The figure presents a graph in the fourth quadrant of an x y plane, with the origin labeled 0. The numbers 5 through 30, in increments of 5, are indicated on the x axis. The numbers negative 0 point 6 and 0 point 6 are indicated on the y axis. The graph begins at the origin and moves horizontally to the right along the x axis until about x equals 12. Then it has two dips, one between 12 and 15 and the other between 15 and 18, that extend to y equals negative 0 point 2. The graph then continues horizontally to the right along the x axis, until it ends at approximately x equals 30.

The figure presents a graph in the first quadrant of an x y plane, with the origin labeled 0. The numbers 5 through 30, in increments of 5, are indicated on the x axis. The numbers negative 0 point 6 and 0 point 6 are indicated on the y axis. The graph begins at the origin and moves horizontally to the right along the x axis, until about x equals 12. Then it has one peak between x equals 12 and 18, that extends to y equals 0 point 5. The graph then continues horizontally to the right along the x axis, until it ends at approximately x equals 30.

The figure presents a graph in an x y plane, with the origin labeled O. The numbers 5 through 30, in increments of 5, are indicated on the x axis. The figure presents a graph in the first and fourth quadrants of an x y plane, with the origin labeled O. The numbers 5 through 30, in increments of 5, are indicated on the x axis. The numbers negative 0 point 6 and 0 point 6 are indicated on the y axis. The graph begins at the origin and moves horizontally to the right along the x axis, until it dips at approximately x equals 12. The dip reaches a minimum of y equals 0 point 2, and then crosses the horizontal axis at x equals 14. The graph continues up to a peak height of 0 point 5 at x equals 15. The graph returns to cross the horizontal axis at x equals 16, then has another dip with a minimum of y equals 0 point 2, and finally returns to the horizontal axis at x equals 17. The graph then continues horizontally to the right along the x axis, until it ends at approximately x equals 30.
